article_node.title: Farmers are pulling back on spending in threat to rural economy
article_node.summary: The US Farm Progress Show highlighted farmers’ bleak outlook amid low crop prices, trade tariffs with China, and uncertain export prospects, even as harvests are expected to be bumper. Credit conditions have worsened, leading to bankruptcies and a slowdown in machinery purchases despite new technology displays. Meanwhile, the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown threatens farm labor, with officials claiming domestic workers could replace migrants, but industry leaders argue automation and Medicaid workers are unrealistic. The overall picture shows a stressed US agricultural sector grappling with trade, credit, and labor challenges.
